title: The neutrino’s quantum fuzziness is beginning to come into focus
description: An experiment studying the neutrino’s “wave packet” sets a limit on the uncertainty of the subatomic particle’s position.
author: Emily Conover

title: A maverick physicist is building a case for scrapping quantum gravity
description: To merge quantum physics and general relativity, physicists aim to quantize gravity. But what if gravity isn’t quantum at all?
author: Emily Conover

title: The development of quantum dots wins the 2023 Nobel prize in chemistry
description: Moungi Bawendi, Louis Brus and Alexei Ekimov split the prize for their work in creating nanoparticles whose properties depend on their size.
author: Carolyn Gramling

title: Clara Sousa-Silva seeks molecular signatures of life in alien atmospheres
description: Quantum astrochemist Clara Sousa-Silva studies how molecules in space interact with light, offering clues to what distant objects are made of.
author: Elise Cutts

title: Quantum computers could break the internet. Here’s how to save it
description: Today's encryption schemes will be vulnerable to future quantum computers, but new algorithms and a quantum internet could help.
author: Emily Conover

title: One photon is all it takes to kick off photosynthesis
description: A single particle of light is the spark that begins the process of turning light to chemical energy in photosynthetic bacteria, a new study confirms.
author: Emily Conover

title: Quantum computers braided ‘anyons,’ long-sought quasiparticles with memory
description: Particle-like quantum states called non-abelian anyons remember being swapped and could be useful for protecting information in quantum computers.
author: Emily Conover

title: A sapphire Schrödinger’s cat shows that quantum effects can scale up
description: The atoms in a piece of sapphire oscillate in two directions at once, a mimic of the hypothetically dead-and-alive feline.
author: Emily Conover

title: Google’s quantum computer reached an error-correcting milestone
description: A larger array of quantum bits outperformed a smaller one in tests performed by Google researchers, suggesting quantum computers could be scaled up.
author: Emily Conover

title: Physicists stored data in quantum holograms made of twisted light
description: Light that travels in corkscrew-like paths provides a way to make holograms that store large amounts of data in ultrasecure packages.
author: James R. Riordon

title: This environmentally friendly quantum sensor runs on sunlight
description: Quantum sensors often rely on power-hungry lasers to make measurements. A new quantum magnetometer uses sunlight to measure magnetic fields instead.
author: James R. Riordon

title: Quantum entanglement makes quantum communication even more secure
description: Bell tests proved that quantum mechanics really is “spooky.” Now they’ve made quantum communication even more hacker-proof.
author: Emily Conover

title: Aliens could send quantum messages to Earth, calculations suggest
description: Scientists are developing quantum communications networks on Earth. Aliens, if they exist, could be going further.
author: Emily Conover

title: Quantum physics exponentially improves some types of machine learning
description: It wasn’t entirely clear if quantum computers could improve machine learning in practice, but new experiments and theoretical proofs show that it can.
author: Emily Conover

title: A new gravity sensor used atoms’ weird quantum behavior to peer underground
description: Quantum sensors promise to be more accurate and stable in the long run than other gravity probes.
author: Maria Temming

title: ‘From Data to Quanta’ defends Niels Bohr’s view of quantum mechanics
description: In his new book, philosopher Slobodan Perović corrects misconceptions about physicist Niels Bohr’s work.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: The quantum ‘boomerang’ effect has been seen for the first time
description: Jostled particles return to their starting points in certain materials, an experiment reveals, confirming theoretical predictions.
author: Emily Conover

title: Quantum particles can feel the influence of gravitational fields they never touch
description: A quantum phenomenon predicted in 1959, the Aharonov-Bohm effect, also applies to gravity.
author: Emily Conover

title: A century of quantum mechanics questions the fundamental nature of reality
description: A century after the quantum revolution, a lot of uncertainty remains.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Quantum physics requires imaginary numbers to explain reality
description: Quantum theory based only on real numbers fails to explain the results of two new experiments.
author: Emily Conover

title: Physicists have coaxed ultracold atoms into an elusive form of quantum matter
description: Quantum spin liquids could be used to help protect fragile information in quantum computers.
author: Emily Conover

title: Scientists finally detected a quantum effect that blocks atoms from scattering light
description: When all available quantum states are full, atoms can’t scatter light, thanks to the Pauli exclusion principle, new experiments show.
author: Emily Conover

title: Scientists are one step closer to error-correcting quantum computers
description: In a quantum computer made with trapped ions, multiple quantum bits were combined into one to detect mistakes.
author: Emily Conover

title: One of nature’s key constants is much larger in a quantum material
description: The fine-structure constant is 10 times its normal value in the material, giving a peek into what physics in an alternate universe could look like.
author: Emily Conover

title: New ‘vortex beams’ of atoms and molecules are the first of their kind
description: Twisted beams of atoms and molecules join other types of corkscrew beams made of light or electrons.
author: Emily Conover

title: A proposed ‘quantum compass’ for songbirds just got more plausible
description: Quantum physics could be behind birds’ magnetic sense of direction, new measurements indicate.
author: Emily Conover

title: Physicists used LIGO’s mirrors to approach a quantum limit
description: Using LIGO’s laser beams to reduce jiggling rather than detect gravitational waves, scientists have gotten closer to the realm of quantum mechanics.
author: Emily Conover

title: Muon magnetism could hint at a breakdown of physics’ standard model
description: After two decades, a new measurement of the muon magnetic anomaly reinforces earlier hints that its value disagrees with standard physics.
author: Emily Conover

title: ‘Designer molecules’ could create tailor-made quantum devices
description: Scientists are making molecules suited to a variety of quantum tasks by building them up, atom by atom.
author: Emily Conover

title: Drones could help create a quantum internet
description: Flying drones sent entangled particles of light to two locations a kilometer apart.
author: Emily Conover

title: The new light-based quantum computer Jiuzhang has achieved quantum supremacy
description: A second type of quantum computer has now performed a calculation impossible for a traditional computer.
author: Emily Conover

title: Galileo’s famous gravity experiment holds up, even with individual atoms
description: When dropped, two types of atoms accelerate at the same rate despite their differences, much like objects in Galileo’s leaning Tower of Pisa experiment.
author: Emily Conover

title: A measurement of positronium’s energy levels confounds scientists
description: A gap in the energy levels of positronium seems to be substantially larger than predicted, and physicists don’t know why.
author: Emily Conover

title: To live up to the hype, quantum computers must repair their error problems
description: Before quantum computers can reach their potential, scientists will need to master quantum error correction.
author: Emily Conover

title: This weird quantum state of matter was made in orbit for the first time
description: Bose-Einstein condensates made on the International Space Station could reach temperatures lower than any known in the universe.
author: Emily Conover

title: Physicists exploit a quantum rule to create a new kind of crystal
description: Cold atoms can form crystals as a result of the Pauli exclusion principle.
author: Emily Conover

title: A newfound superconducting current travels only along a material’s edge
description: In a first, scientists spot electricity flowing without resistance on the rim of a topological superconductor.
author: Emily Conover

title: New quantum computers can operate at higher temperatures
description: Silicon chips operate at higher temperatures than many others, raising hopes for building quantum integrated circuits.
author: Emily Conover

title: Quantum mechanics means some black hole orbits are impossible to predict
description: Computer simulations reveal that foreseeing the paths of three orbiting objects sometimes requires precision better than the quantum limit.
author: Emily Conover

title: Scientists entangled quantum memories linked over long distances
description: The entanglement of quantum ‘hard drives’ is a crucial step toward creating a quantum internet.
author: Emily Conover

title: Scientists cooled a nanoparticle to the quantum limit
description: Physicists decreased a nanoparticle’s motion to the lowest level allowed by quantum mechanics.
author: Emily Conover

title: A quantum strategy could verify the solutions to unsolvable problems — in theory
description: A quantum technique for verifying solutions to difficult problems could apply to an “unbelievably huge” class of puzzles.
author: Emily Conover

title: Google claimed quantum supremacy in 2019 — and sparked controversy
description: Google’s quantum computer outperformed the most powerful supercomputer on a task, the company reported. But some scientists aren’t fully convinced.
author: Emily Conover

title: Quantum jitter lets heat travel across a vacuum
description: In a first, scientists observed tiny, vibrating membranes exchanging heat due to quantum fluctuations.
author: Emily Conover

title: A new, theoretical type of time crystal could run without outside help
description: The idea tiptoes closer to the original concept of time crystals, first proposed in 2012.
author: Emily Conover

title: Google officially lays claim to quantum supremacy
description: The quantum computer Sycamore reportedly performed a calculation that even the most powerful supercomputers available can’t reproduce.
author: Emily Conover

title: Monika Schleier-Smith leads elaborate quantum conversations
description: Monika Schleier-Smith forces atoms to interact in ways that could offer insights into quantum computing, precision timekeeping and perhaps black holes.
author: Elizabeth Quill

title: Sean Carroll’s new book argues quantum physics leads to many worlds
description: ‘Something Deeply Hidden’ offers a defense of The Many Worlds Interpretation of quantum mechanics.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Rumors hint that Google has accomplished quantum supremacy
description: Reports suggest a quantum computer has bested standard computers on one type of calculation, but practical applications are still a distant goal.
author: Emily Conover

title: Quantum physicists have teleported ‘qutrits’ for the first time
description: The technique could be useful for creating a future quantum internet.
author: Emily Conover

title: In a first, scientists took the temperature of a sonic black hole
description: A lab-made black hole that traps sound, not light, emits radiation at a certain temperature, as Stephen Hawking first predicted.
author: Emily Conover

title: An experiment hints at quantum entanglement inside protons
description: Particles inside protons seem to be linked on a scale smaller than a trillionth of a millimeter.
author: Emily Conover

title: Antimatter keeps with quantum theory. It’s both particle and wave
description: A new variation of the classic double-slit experiment confirms that antimatter, like normal matter, has wave-particle duality.
author: Maria Temming

title: A science-themed escape room gives the brain a workout
description: Quantum physicist Paul Kwiat reveals what it takes do well in LabEscape, his science-themed escape room.
author: Emily Conover

title: A new quantum engine packs more power than its standard counterparts
description: A new type of tiny machine harnesses quantum physics to produce more power than a normal engine, under certain conditions.
author: Emily Conover

title: How a proton gets its spin is surprisingly complicated
description: Pinning down the source of protons’ spin is surprisingly hard to do.
author: Emily Conover

title: LIGO will be getting a quantum upgrade
description: Quantum squeezing of light will help scientists make better gravitational wave detectors.
author: Emily Conover

title: Photons reveal a weird effect called the quantum pigeonhole paradox
description: Quantum particles seem to disobey a fundamental principle of mathematics.
author: Emily Conover

title: ‘Beyond Weird’ and ‘What Is Real?’ try to make sense of quantum weirdness
description: The books ‘Beyond Weird’ and ‘What is Real?’ have different perspectives on what quantum physics says about reality.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Physicists wrangled electrons into a quantum fractal
description: The tiny, repeating structure could reveal weird behavior of electrons in fractional dimensions.
author: Emily Conover

title: Douglas Stanford probes the chaos inside black holes
description: Theoretical physicist Douglas Stanford is linking some of the most massive objects known to the quantum realm.
author: Emily Conover

title: Rubidium atoms mimic the Eiffel Tower, a Möbius strip and other 3-D shapes
description: Scientists have arranged atoms of the element rubidium into complex three-dimensional structures.
author: Emily Conover

title: Quantum computer simulates two types of bizarre materials
description: In calculations involving about 2,000 quantum bits, a D-Wave machine reproduced the behavior of exotic substances.
author: Emily Conover

title: A new quantum device defies the concepts of ‘before’ and ‘after’
description: Two events can happen in different orders at the same time, thanks to quantum physics.
author: Emily Conover

title: Designer diamonds could one day help build a quantum internet
description: A new design in artificial diamonds stores and releases quantum information better than others.
author: Maria Temming

title: Mini machines can evade friction by taking quantum shortcuts
description: Special maneuvers allow researchers to create tiny machines that are as efficient as possible.
author: Emily Conover

title: A tiny version of this physics toy is revealing quantum secrets
description: Scientists created a quantum Newton’s cradle to study thermal equilibrium.
author: Emily Conover

title: Split atom clouds get entangled in quantum tests
description: Scientists create quantum links between clouds consisting of thousands of atoms.
author: Emily Conover

title: Spooky quantum entanglement goes big in new experiments
description: Scientists entangled the motions of two jiggling devices that are visible with a magnifying glass or even the naked eye — if you have keen vision.
author: Emily Conover

title: Superconductors may shed light on the black hole information paradox
description: Materials that conduct electricity without resistance might mimic black hole physics.
author: Emily Conover

title: Google moves toward quantum supremacy with 72-qubit computer
description: Google’s 72-qubit quantum chip may eventually perform a task beyond the ability of traditional computers.
author: Emily Conover

title: Two-way communication is possible with a single quantum particle
description: One photon can transmit information in two directions at once.
author: Emily Conover

title: Quantum computers go silicon
description: Scientists performed the first quantum algorithms in silicon, and probed quantum bits with light.
author: Emily Conover

title: A quantum communications satellite proved its potential in 2017
description: Quantum communication through space is now possible, putting the quantum internet within closer reach.
author: Emily Conover

title: ‘Arrow of time’ reversed in quantum experiment
description: In quantum systems, heat can flow “backward,” from cold to hot.
author: Emily Conover

title: Quantum computing steps forward with 50-qubit prototype
description: Bit by qubit, scientists are edging closer to the realm where quantum computers will reign supreme.
author: Emily Conover

title: Quantum computers take a step forward with a 50-qubit prototype
description: Race to build ever-more-powerful processors edges the technology closer to being able to best traditional machines.
author: Emily Conover

title: Photons are caught behaving like superconducting electrons
description: Light particles, or photons, swap energy like electrons in a superconductor.
author: Emily Conover

title: Light’s weird dual nature weathers trip to space and back
description: “Delayed-choice” experiment performed in space reaffirms the idea that light can behave like a wave or a particle.
author: Emily Conover

title: Quantum mysteries dissolve if possibilities are realities
description: Quantum mysteries can be avoided if reality encompasses possibilities as well as actualities, a new paper proposes.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Quantum video chat links scientists on two different continents
description: A Sept. 29 ultrasecure quantum video chat demonstrates the potential for quantum communications across the globe.
author: Emily Conover

title: A new test of water ripples supports the idea of quantum heat in a vacuum
description: Water waves bolster theory that accelerating space travelers really feel the heat.
author: Emily Conover

title: Minuscule jitters may hint at quantum collapse mechanism
description: Vibrations of a tiny cantilever could help reveal why quantum rules fail on large scales.
author: Emily Conover

title: Tiny quantum storage device fits on a chip
description: Photon information processing on nanoscale could enable future communication networks.
author: Maria Temming

title: Modern-day Alice trades looking glass for wormhole to explore quantum wonderland
description: A new paper shows how the possibility of wormholes linking quantum-entangled black holes could be tested in the laboratory.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Quantum tunneling takes time, new study shows
description: A new measurement disfavors the idea that electrons can escape atoms instantaneously.
author: Emily Conover

title: China’s quantum satellite adds two new tricks to its repertoire
description: Satellite performs quantum teleportation and securely transmits encryption keys.
author: Emily Conover

title: Dive deep to discover unexpected connections
description: Readers often praise Science News for its brevity. But some ideas need more space, writes acting editor in chief Elizabeth Quill.
author: Elizabeth Quill

title: A quarter century ago, the qubit was born
description: The invention of the qubit a quarter century ago enabled the quantum information revolution.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Quantum computers are about to get real
description: Qubit-based machines are gearing up to solve problems that are out of reach for even the most powerful supercomputers.
author: Emily Conover

title: Quantum satellite shatters entanglement record
description: A satellite sent entangled particles to two Chinese cities 1,200 kilometers apart.
author: Emily Conover

title: Quantum tractor beam could tug atoms, molecules
description: The wavelike behavior of quantum particles could be harnessed to move atoms.
author: Emily Conover

title: Key Einstein principle survives quantum test
description: Particles in quantum superposition adhere to the equivalence principle in atomic test.
author: Emily Conover

title: There’s still a lot we don’t know about the proton
description: Researchers are puzzling over the proton's radius, spin and whether it decays.
author: Emily Conover

title: Millions of atoms entangled in record-breaking quantum tests
description: Scientists make advance in the quest to take quantum effects to larger scales.
author: Emily Conover

title: Quantum counterfeiters might succeed
description: Physicists demonstrate security issue with quantum cash.
author: Emily Conover

title: Readers amazed by Amasia
description: Quantum spookiness, shifting landmasses and more in reader feedback.
author: Science News Staff

title: Vacuum’s quantum effect on light detected
description: Light can be polarized through interactions with empty space.
author: Emily Conover

title: Cosmic test confirms quantum weirdness
description: Physicists used starlight to perform a cosmic Bell test.
author: Emily Conover

title: Readers ponder hominid hookups and more
description: Neandertal evolution, quantum internet and more in reader feedback.
author: Science News Staff

title: Why quantum mechanics might need an overhaul
description: Nobel laureate Steven Weinberg says current debates in quantum mechanics need a new approach to comprehend reality.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: ‘Time crystal’ created in lab
description: A chain of ions creates a crystal that repeats in time instead of in space.
author: Emily Conover

title: Taming photons, electrons paves way for quantum internet
description: Scientists are gearing up to create supersecure global quantum networks.
author: Emily Conover

title: Experiment confirms plan for quantum-coded messages
description: A new way to send secret quantum messages uses shorter keys.
author: Laurel Hamers

title: A new ‘Einstein’ equation suggests wormholes hold key to quantum gravity
description: A new Einsteinian equation, ER=EPR, may be the clue physicists need to merge quantum mechanics with general relativity.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: General relativity has readers feeling upside down
description: Readers respond to the June 25, 2016, issue of Science News with questions on Earth's age, moaning whales, plate tectonics and more.
author: Science News Staff

title: Quantum fragility may help birds navigate
description: Birds’ internal compasses may rely on the delicate nature of the quantum world.
author: Emily Conover

title: Quantum weirdness survives space travel
description: Quantum weirdness travels from Earth to space and back again.
author: Emily Conover

title: Schrödinger’s cat now dead and alive in two boxes at once
description: The living-dead feline has been split in two, using a system of microwaves inside superconducting cavities.
author: Emily Conover

title: Physicists smash particle imitators
description: A new quasiparticle collider smashes together the faux-particles that appear in solid materials.
author: Emily Conover

title: Communicating covertly goes quantum
description: Researchers are working to make quantum messages that are undetectable.
author: Emily Conover

title: Information is physical, even in quantum systems, study suggests
description: A thermodynamic principle says that deleting information generates heat, and now, scientists say that goes for quantum systems, too.
author: Emily Conover

title: Gamers outperform computer at quantum task
description: Quantum mechanics may be weird, but a new video game shows that human intuition can still best computers at quantum tasks.
author: Emily Conover

title: Finding wonders in fat
description: In the latest issue of Science News, Editor in Chief Eva Emerson talks fat cells, thermodynamics, and lead poisoning.
author: Eva Emerson

title: Ultrasmall engines bend second law of thermodynamics
description: Car engines and batteries run because of the second law of thermodynamics, which appears to work, with just a little bending, for ultrasmall engines in the quantum realm as well.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Entanglement is spooky, but not action at a distance
description: Recent experiments on quantum entanglement confirm that it’s spooky, but it was not, as Einstein implied, action at a distance.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Quantum spookiness survives its toughest tests
description: Recent experiments on quantum entanglement confirm that it’s spooky, but it was not, as Einstein implied, action at a distance.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Quantum histories get all tangled up
description: Multiple versions of history may be quantum entangled just like particles, a new experiment suggests.
author: Andrew Grant

title: At last, some details on Stephen Hawking’s solution to black hole problem
description: Stephen Hawking and colleagues have finally provided more information about how black holes might preserve information.
author: Andrew Grant

title: More details on Stephen Hawking’s solution to black hole problem
description: Stephen Hawking and colleagues have finally provided more information about how black holes might preserve information.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Year in review: Quantum spookiness is real
description: A new version of an experiment proposed in 1964 confirmed a counterintuitive tenet of quantum mechanics.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Google’s quantum computer speeds up, but practical use is unclear
description: Google’s D-Wave quantum computer is getting faster, but it’s still unclear whether it will ever outperform regular computers at completing useful tasks.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Elusive chemical reaction transition state captured
description: A new method provides a detailed look at the elusive transition state.
author: Laura Sanders

title: Spooky quantum connection quantified for multiple particles
description: Physicists have measured quantum entanglement between several particles rather than just two.
author: Andrew Grant

title: More tests confirm quantum spookiness
description: New experimental results confirm and strengthen evidence for the “spooky” reality of quantum physics.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Quantum spookiness, magnetic mysteries and more feedback
description: Letters and comments from readers on quantum spookiness, Earth's magnetic field, and more.
author: Science News Staff

title: Light mimics hotel with limitless vacancies
description: By mimicking a mathematician’s method for creating vacancies in a hotel with an infinite number of rooms, physicists may have found a way of increasing the amount of data that can be carried via light.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Quantum interpretations feel the heat
description: Landauer’s principle shows a way to test competing interpretations about quantum physics.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Confirmed: Quantum mechanics is weird
description: The first demonstration of a loophole-free Bell test validates the weirdness of quantum physics.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Future quantum computing could exploit old technology
description: Silicon transistors have been modified and patched together to form logic gates that could perform calculations in future quantum computers.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Entanglement: Gravity’s long-distance connection
description: The universe may be a vast quantum computer that safely encodes spacetime in an elaborate web of entanglement.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Quantum choice can be counterproductive
description: In a puzzling paradox, delivering quantum messages becomes more difficult if the intended recipient offers the sender multiple options for the time and place of delivery.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Shinsei Ryu: Error-free quantum calculations
description: Physicist Shinsei Ryu navigates the confusing border between the quantum and everyday realms.
author: Thomas Sumner

title: New experiment verifies quantum spookiness
description: A new experiment provides the most robust proof that quantum mechanics doesn’t follow the rules we take for granted in everyday life.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Hawking proposes solution to black hole problem
description: Light sliding along the boundary of a black hole encodes everything that ever fell inside, suggests Stephen Hawking in a new but incomplete proposal.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Physicists get answers from computer that didn’t run
description: By exploiting the quirks of quantum mechanics, physicists consistently determined what a quantum computer would have done without actually running the computer.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Quantum communication takes a new twist
description: A three-kilometer transmission of light above the Vienna skyline demonstrates that scientists can use the twistiness of light to encode delicate quantum information.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Quantum dots get a second chance to shine
description: Quantum dots, semiconductor particles that can emit a rainbow of colors, have been put to work observing living cells, with possible benefits for medical diagnosis.
author: Alexandra Witze

title: Quantum experiment dissects wave-particle mash-up
description: A modified version of a landmark quantum physics experiment has shown that a single parcel of light can be a particle and a wave simultaneously.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Atomic clock will keep precise time for 15 billion years
description: The world’s most precise atomic clock will not lose or gain a second in roughly 15 billion years.
author: Andrew Grant

title: One photon wrangles 3,000 atoms into quantum entanglement
description: A single photon can trigger the creation of quantum entanglement between thousands of atoms.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Quantum links provide clues to causation
description: Quantum entanglement enables physicists to determine cause and effect just by tracking the association between two measurements.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Finding quantum entanglement in a crowd
description: Physicists have measured entanglement between pairs of photons within a macroscopic beam of light, a first step toward understanding how particles’ quantum connections lead to large-scale effects.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Light trick can retrieve missed messages
description: Even if photons pass you by, you can still snatch a signal from their electromagnetic wake, physicists propose.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Trying to get the down-low on gravity
description: A twist on a classic quantum mechanics experiment could lead to the discovery of elusive gravitons.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Physicists double their teleportation power
description: In a teleportation first, physicists transfer two quantum properties from one photon to another.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Quantum guessing game uses the future to predict the past
description: Physicists extrapolate forward and backward in time to make accurate predictions about an object’s quantum state at a particular moment.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Top 10 scientific mysteries for the 21st century
description: Solving the Top 10 scientific mysteries facing the 21st century will not be all fun but could be mostly games.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Physicists debate whether quantum math is as real as atoms
description: Physicists debate whether quantum states are as real as atoms or are just tools for forecasting phenomena.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Bell’s math showed that quantum weirdness rang true
description: 50 years ago, John Bell proved a theorem that led the way to establishing the weirdness of quantum physics.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Two new particles found at Large Hadron Collider
description: Physicists with the Large Hadron Collider beauty experiment have identified two new particles called Xi_b'- and Xi_b*-.
author: Science News Staff

title: Milestone algorithm runs on quantum computer
description: An algorithm proposed two decades ago that demonstrated the benefit of using quantum mechanics to solve certain problems has finally been run on a quantum computer.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Magnetic detector identifies single protons
description: An MRI-like machine can scan an individual proton, raising prospects that a similar technique could eventually image biological molecules one by one.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Hawking radiation spotted within sonic black hole
description: Lab-created sonic black hole emits energy as famed physicist Stephen Hawking predicted, though the experiment may not be definitive.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Photons on roundabout route could get caught in action
description: Proposed twist on classic double-slit experiment could identify light that weaves in and out.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Quasiparticles help physicists make sense of the world
description: To improve semiconductors, superconductors and other materials, physicists view a particle and its surroundings as one entity.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Three photons entangled, not just two
description: Physicists have found a way to entangle a trio of photons, but it works only once in every quadrillion attempts.
author: Andrew Grant

title: New analysis rescues quantum wave-particle duality
description: An experiment that supposedly contradicted the wave-particle duality principle of quantum physics has been reanalyzed, revealing a flaw.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Artificial atom probes sound’s quantum side
description: Scientists have designed an artificial atom to emit sound that is divided into quantum particles.
author: Ashley Yeager

title: Holography entangles quantum physics with gravity
description: Spacetime geometry, and therefore gravity, emerges from quantum entanglement, analyses using tensor networks show.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Molecules stop tumbling with hit of laser light
description: Stopping molecules' rotation with a custom laser could help scientists harness them for quantum computing.
author: Ashley Yeager

title: Tensor networks get entangled with quantum gravity
description: Using tensors to describe quantum entanglement shows promise as a way to understand gravity.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Blind quantum camera snaps photos of Schrödinger’s cat
description: Quantum weirdness lets physicists snap photo without collecting incoming light from cardboard cat subject.
author: Thomas Sumner

title: Birds’ turns match math of quantum matter
description: Equations that describe superfluidity may explain how information about which way and when to turn spreads in a starling flock.
author: Ashley Yeager

title: Quantum Cheshire Cat experiment splits particles from their properties
description: When facing a fork in the road, neutrons appear to go in one direction and their spins in the other.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Quantum connection could revitalize superstrings
description: Status of superstrings could be elevated by their ability to explain the mysterious rules of quantum mechanics.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: You shouldn’t try to pigeonhole quantum physics
description: A quantum analysis shows a way to violate math’s pigeonhole principle, by allowing three particles in two boxes with no two in the same box.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Quantum math makes human irrationality more sensible
description: Vagaries of human decision making make sense if quantum math describes the way the brain works.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Electrons’ magnetic interactions measured
description: Using characteristics of quantum mechanics, the minuscule magnetic interaction between two electrons has been measured.
author: Ashley Yeager

title: Commercial quantum computer fails to impress in new test
description: Fifteen million dollar D-Wave machine runs no faster than traditional computer in head-to-head challenge.
author: Andrew Grant

title: How to build a quantum-entangled superclock
description: A blueprint for a quantum-entangled superclock suggests that such a device could enable startlingly precise measurements of Earth’s terrain.
author: Science News Staff

title: Maybe classical clockwork can explain quantum weirdness
description: Nobel laureate Gerard ’t Hooft proposes that a classical cause-and-effect reality underlies the probabilistic strangeness of quantum physics.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: The least physics you need is a lot in ‘Quantum Mechanics’
description: Leonard Susskind and Art Friedman walk readers through the basics needed to understand the quantum realm.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Nobel laureates offer new interpretations of quantum mysteries
description: Two Nobel laureates offer novel interpretations to explain the mysteries of quantum mechanics.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Quantum cryptography could shed test for hackers
description: An added protection of a proposed quantum cryptography method makes eavesdropping nearly impossible.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Next-gen quantum teleportation in just 2 photons
description: Researchers teleport quantum information between two photons instead of the standard three.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Major step taken toward error-free computing
description: Physicists have achieved nearly perfect control over a bit of quantum information, bringing them a step closer to error-free computation.
author: Gabriel Popkin

title: Shor’s code-breaking algorithm inspired reflections on quantum information
description: Twenty years ago, physicists met in Santa Fe to explore the ramifications of quantum information.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Excitons’ motions captured in images
description: Scientists have observed how quasiparticles called excitons move.
author: Ashley Yeager

title: Quantum experts discuss the measurement problem: A transcript from 1994
description: A fairly complete transcript of a discussion about quantum physics on May 19, 1994, the last day of a workshop in Santa Fe, N.M., evolves into a more general discussion of the interpretation of quantum mechanics and the quantum measurement problem.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Robert Redford film foretold Shor’s quantum computing bombshell
description: Twenty years ago, Peter Shor showed how quantum computers could break secret codes, turning the movie Sneakers from fiction to fact.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Small step taken for quantum communication
description: A single atom can change the state of a photon, which may help build quantum networks.
author: Ashley Yeager

title: U.S. marches to tick of new clock
description: The atomic clock NIST-F2 has launched as the country’s official civilian time and frequency standard.
author: Science News Staff

title: Finding a quantum way to make free will possible
description: Maybe quantum influences from the Big Bang make humans unpredictable, permitting the possibility of free will.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Quantum timekeeping
description: Recent advances in controlling the quantum behavior of particles have inspired physicists to dream of a global clock that would tell the same time everywhere. It would be hundreds of times as accurate as current atomic clocks.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Einstein was wrong about spooky quantum entanglement
description: Einstein’s biggest blunder wasn’t about vacuum energy in space, but in confusing people about quantum entanglement.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: History affects superfluid’s flow, study shows
description: The speed to stop the stirring motion can be slower than what was need to set the fluid spinning in the first place, which shows that what happens to the current state of the superatom depends on what it has already experienced.
author: Ashley Yeager

title: Tom’s Top 10 interpretations of quantum mechanics
description: Quantum mechanics has given birth to dozens of interpretations, which themselves need interpretations.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Single-pole magnet emerges in frozen concoction
description: An experiment has simulated the long-sought magnetic particle.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Atomic clock sets world records for precision, stability
description: The strontium atomic clock is about 50 percent more precise than the previous record holder made of a single charged aluminum atom and rivals the ytterbium atomic clock for the title of most stable.
author: Ashley Yeager

title: Gell-Mann, Hartle spin a quantum narrative about reality
description: The “consistent histories” approach to quantum physics removes any role for people in creating “quasiclassical” reality.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: ‘QBists’ tackle quantum problems by adding a subjective aspect to science
description: Advocates of a program called “Quantum Bayesianism” take a subjective approach to resolving the paradoxes of quantum physics.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Electrons’ roundness frustrates researchers
description: Experiment finds no signs of asymmetry, which would point to undiscovered particles.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Quantum information storage that lasts and lasts
description: Physicists have stored a snippet of quantum information at room temperature for more than 1,000 times the previous record.
author: Gabriel Popkin

title: Single atoms hold on to information
description: Minutes-long data storage by individual atoms beats previous record of tiny fraction of a second.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Electron makes ultracold atoms move as one
description: Harnessing the strong particle-gas interaction is early step toward quantum optics applications.
author: Ashley Yeager

title: Single electron caught in action
description: Researchers have found a way to isolate the behavior of one particle.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Heisenberg’s instinct was accurate
description: Scientists develop mathematical proof of quantum physics feature first suggested more than 80 years ago.
author: Ashley Yeager

title: New limit placed on physics constant
description: An analysis of how much the fine structure constant varies with the density of matter may help scientists determine whether the parameter changes with time.
author: Gabriel Popkin

title: Simulating reactions in cyberspace earns Nobel Prize in chemistry
description: Computer models that meld quantum and classical calculations have earned three scientists the 2013 Nobel Prize in chemistry.
author: Science News

title: Quantum teleportation approaches the computer chip
description: Researchers speedily transmit information from  one tiny circuit to another on solid-state device.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Most precise clock
description: It would take more than 50 billion years for a new atomic clock to gain or lose a second.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Light breaks up to cloak gaps in time
description: Method could hide messages without sender’s knowledge.
author: Andrew Grant

title: Quantum teleportation leaps forward
description: Two teams report beaming information about particles over long distances, a step toward creating satellite quantum communication networks.
author: Alexandra Witze

title: New system offers way to defeat decryption by quantum computers
author: Julie Rehmeyer

title: Like fate of cat, quantum debate is still unresolved
description: Entanglement is now one of the hottest research fields in physics. It is pursued not only for insights into the nature of reality, but also for developing new technologies.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Everyday Entanglement
description: Physicists are taking quantum weirdness out of the lab.
author: Laura Sanders

title: Clash of the Quantum Titans
description: After decades of debate, disputes over the mathematical rules governing reality remain unresolved.
author: Tom Siegfried

title: Higgs and his particle prove elusive
description: Peter Higgs and colleagues receive particle theory prize; scientists still hunting the proposed boson
author: Ron Cowen

title: Quantum information teleported between distant atoms
description: A team is the first to transfer a qubit, which contains quantum information, from one atom to another, a feat that could aid quantum computing and secure communication.
author: Patrick Barry
